第1回:
*All contents below subject to change, depending on needs and interests of the enrolled students.

Week 1: class overview, introductions, ice breakers
第2回: Week 2: Economy and taxes in Japan and Canada, discussion of first 250-word journal (economics topic #1)
第3回: Week 3: Womenomics - the role of working women in the Japanese economy, discussion of second 250-word journal (economics topic #2)
第4回: Week 4: Energy and housing - different cross-cultural perceptions on energy and the value of homes, discussion of third 250-word journal (economics topic #3)
第5回: Week 5: Japanese and Canadian companies, discussion of fourth 250-word journal (business topic #1)
第6回: Week 6: Advertising in Japan and the world, introduction of final presentation, discussion of fifth 250-word journal (business topic #2)
第7回: Week 7: Importing, exporting, the OECD better life index and its influence on business, discussion of sixth 250-word journal (business topic #3)
第8回: Week 8: The 2020 Olympics in Tokyo and its impact on domestic politics, economics, and business; discussion of seventh 250-word journal (hybrid topic #1)
第9回: Week 9: Liberalism vs. Conservatism in North America, discussion of eighth 250-word journal (politics topic #1)
第10回: Week 10: same-sex marriage or other social political issue, discussion of ninth 250-word journal (politics topic #2)
第11回: Week 11: age of adulthood or other social political issue, discussion of final 250-word journal (politics topic #3)
トピック.授業外学習2: Each class will involve information and topics that will need to be applied to a final presentation. It is the students’ responsibility to make notes during each class so they can successfully accomplish this. Also, a 250-word weekly journal will be assigned involving the discussion contents of the next class. On average, this assignment should take one to two hours per week. You should have a stable wifi or internet connection at home to complete all out-of-class assignments.
